DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECT The objective of the Project is to support the Recipient to get more resources to where they are needed most to improve the delivery of health services in districts and sub- districts, through the Recipient's linked sector plan, budget, and monitoring and evaluation approach, and the development of stronger financial management and procurement systems, capacity, and partnerships. The Project consists of the following components: Component 1: Improving Putlic Financial Management and Fund Flows for Health Service Delivery Support the Recipient to assit central and district health teams to use the resources available to them more efficientl y, equitably and effectively by: (a) strengthening Ministry of Health's central and district planning and budgeting in line with the Recipient's "One Plan, One Budget, One Sector Monitoriag and Evaluation Framework" concept through the preparation of annual activity plans and budgets that are focused on improved health service delivery; (b) advocating for an increased overall health budget allocation that has adequate provision for recurrent costs for essential health service delivery across the country; and (c) increasing flexible and innovative financing, such as grants to districts, for district service delivery.I Component 2: Strenathening Pharmaceutical and Medical Supplies Manaaement Support the Recipient in ensuring adequate essential pharmaceuticals and supply availability to improve health service delivery by: (a) strengthening the clinical and logistics management capacity of the hea th sector; (b) strengthening regulatory capacity of the health sector; and (c) improving quality control.2 Component 3: Improvina Evidence-Informed Decision Making and Health Sector Coordination Support the Recipient to )uild the capacity of central and district health teams to make evidence-informed decisions anc coordinate the health sector by: (a) developing and using an agreed sector monitoring and eNaluation framework to assess performance across the health sector; (b) institutionalizing heal :h sector coordination group meetings and joint annual sector (planning and performance) re- iews; and (c) strengthening the capacity to plan, conduct, approve, oversee and disseminate res.arch in the health sector.3 1 This component includes Activities ., 4, ind 5 of the Action Fiche approved by the Commission Financing Decis on (CRIS - FED/2011/022-743) and tLe Financing Agreement signed between the EU and the Government of Tirnor Leste on July 5, 2012. 2 This component corresponds to Activ ty 2 of the above mentioned legal documents. 3 Thii component corresponds to Activ ty 3 of the above mentioned legal documents.
